logic.JustDoIt

Class logic

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.JustDoIt.logic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILogic

    public class logic
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILogic
    This class is the logic. The logic acquires parsed user command from the UI and return the result of the execution of the corresponding command
    Author:
    Cui Wei

      • executeCommand

        public java.lang.Object executeCommand(java.lang.String[] info)
        This function executes commands of the user and return a string indicating the executing results of each corresponding command
        Specified by:
        executeCommand in interface ILogic
        Parameters:
        info - is a string array containing all the information of a user's input string parsed by a parser object

      • add

        public java.lang.String add(java.lang.String[] info)
        This function creates a task object and adds it to the current arrayList
        Parameters:
        info - is the command input containing information of the added task by the user
        Returns:
        ADDED_SUCCESS is a String indicating that the task has been successfully added to the schedule

      • deleteAll

        public java.lang.String deleteAll()
        This function deletes all the tasks stored in the string
        Returns:
        DELETED_All_TASKS_SUCCESS is a String indicating that the task has been successfully deleted

      • deleteByIndex

        public java.lang.String deleteByIndex(int i)
        This function deletes a task object from the current arrayList according to the index. Note that this function can only be executed after a search or display function
        Parameters:
        i - is the index in the toDisplay arrayList
        Returns:
        DELETED_SINGLE_TASK_SUCCESS is a String indicating that corresponding the task has been successfully deleted

      • deleteCompleted

        public java.lang.String deleteCompleted()
        This function deletes all the completed tasks
        Returns:
        DELETED_COMPLETED_TASKS_SUCCESS is a String indicating that all the completed tasks have been successfully deleted

      • deleteByKeyword

        public java.lang.String deleteByKeyword(java.lang.String keyword)
        This function deletes a task object from the schedule according to the keyword
        Parameters:
        keyword - is a string containing the keyword inputed by the user
        Returns:
        DELETED_SINGLE_TASK_SUCCESS is a String indicating that the tasks have been successfully deleted

      • updateTask

        public java.lang.String updateTask(java.lang.String taskName,
                          java.lang.String newName,
                          java.lang.String startTime,
                          java.lang.String endTime)
        This function updates the name or(and) time of a task
        Parameters:
        taskName - is a string containing the task name of the task that the user want to modify
        newName - is a string of new task name the user want to change to
        startTime - is a string of new start time the user want to change to
        endTime - is a string of new end time the user want to change to
        Returns:
        UPDATE_TASKSUCCESS is an string indicating a success of updating

      • updateStatus

        public java.lang.String updateStatus(java.lang.String taskName,
                            java.lang.String status)
        This function updates the status of a task
        Parameters:
        taskName - is a string containing the task name of the task that the user want to modify
        status - is a string of task status the user want to change to
        Returns:
        UPDATE_TASK_STATUS_SUCCESS is an string indicating a success of updating

        Returns:
